page.title: 11Rangemore Estate Livestock
page.content: There are{750 cattle}altogether on Rangemore Estate, mainly Friesians, including 2 bulls, 150 beef cattle, 360 dairy cows in two herds, and the young stock. At{Highlands Park Farm}it takes from 6.00 to 7.30 a.m. to milk 140 cows, and at{Home Farm}it takes from 5.45 to 8.30 a.m. to milk 220 cows. The milk goes to Northern Dairies at Ashby, and to the Milk Marketing Board who make yoghurt, cheese & butter. 210 cows calve during September and October, and 150 calve from November to March. The{other animals}on the farms are: 30 sheep, 2 young pigs, 2 goats, 6 dogs and 2 cats. The lakes on the estate are{fished regularly, and there are{pheasant {shoots}from October to February. The {Meynell and South Staffs Hunt}meets on the estate from time to time.
